org.apache.tephra.persist

Interface TransactionLogWriter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable

    public interface TransactionLogWriter
extends Closeable
    Common interface for transaction log writers used by classes extending AbstractTransactionLog.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void append(AbstractTransactionLog.Entry entry)
      Adds a new transaction entry to the log.
      void commitMarker(int count)
      Makes an entry of number of transaction entries that will follow in that log in a single sync.
      void sync()
      Syncs any pending transaction edits added through append(AbstractTransactionLog.Entry), but not yet flushed to durable storage.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • append

        void append(AbstractTransactionLog.Entry entry)
            throws IOException
        Adds a new transaction entry to the log. Note that this does not guarantee that the entry has been flushed to persistent storage until sync() has been called.
        Parameters:
        entry - The transaction edit to append.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing the edit to storage.

      • commitMarker

        void commitMarker(int count)
                  throws IOException
        Makes an entry of number of transaction entries that will follow in that log in a single sync.
        Parameters:
        count - Number of transaction entries.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing the count to storage.

      • sync

        void sync()
          throws IOException
        Syncs any pending transaction edits added through append(AbstractTransactionLog.Entry), but not yet flushed to durable storage.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while flushing the outstanding edits.
